author: wsjcom
title: Asian Morning Briefing: U.S. Stocks Slide -
text:
MARKETS AT A GLANCE
(Data as of approximately 5 p.m. ET)
SNAPSHOT:
U.S. stocks stumbled after a gloomy earnings forecast from Wal-Mart Stores. The yield on the 10-year U.S. government debt fell to a five-month low, gold prices surged and the dollar fell as fresh signs of tepid consumer spending and low inflation boosted demand for haven assets. Oil prices eased amid concerns about the global oversupply of crude.
